channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rattling manhole cover, 10th July
item.description:
A435 northbound between j/w Stoke Orchard Road and roundabout j/w Sapphire Road, close to bus stop .This appears to be recent .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Newly planted tree causing problems, 10th July
item.description:
Newly planted one year old tree is growing fast and will cause problems with our existing solar panels. Have contacted GCC and asked them to prevent growing too high but they say they do not trim trees because of solar panels. Our solar panels have been insitu for over seven years. Can you help please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132, Cromwell Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: High grass from bus shelter towards Cirencester for approx 50 metres, 10th July
item.description:
I have reported this twice that it is extremely dangerous to pull out of the Coberley junction as drivers cannot see oncoming vehicles from Cirencester due to high grass from the bus shelter for approx 50 metres towards Cirencester. There is zero visibility for car drivers pulling out. I had a reply to say it was not an issue. Today there has been a catastrophic accident at the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 10th July
item.description:
email regarding speed bumps causing vibration to property - see attached
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abaondoned vehicle Detmore Close, 10th July
item.description:
A MAZDA CX30 BW21 VUA no back number plate that has been stolen. This has been standing in Detmore Close, Charlton Kings for over 6 months. It is believed to be a lease car (could be Brindleys Garage Ltd) the the person leasing has gone away not coming back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Detmore Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole/sunken drain cover at corner of Suffolk Road and Bath Road Cheltenham (in Suffolk Road on south side), 10th July
item.description:
If a cyclist cycles from A40 Thirlestaine Road Cheltenham across the Bath Road into A40 Suffolk Road at the lights Suffolk Road is not directly opposite Thirlestaine Road and there is a sunken drain cover with pothole on the corner in Suffolk Road. The combination of these factors means the cyclist has to pull out into the path of traffic crossing Bath Road behind him. This is very dangerous, particularly if you are not aware of the problem. Can the drain cover be moved/flattened?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Suffolk Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two potholes in close proximity, one slightly larger than the other, deep and broken up tarmac, 10th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swallow Crescent, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
